CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 27, 1957, pg. A8, reads: "'Mother Bethel' bows to progress... 'and the walls come tumbling down.'" Portion of accompanying article by B. H. Logan reads: "...We might weep over the demise of this old building, but the church itself will continue to shine brighter and brighter until that final day.  Bethel AME Church is the oldest Negro congregation in Pittsburgh or Allegheny County.  It has contributed thousands of dollars to Wilberforce University and other institutions of learning.  It has contributed to Christian missions both home and foreign.  The people of Pittsburgh should never forget this struggling congregation.  We should stop long enough to sing her praises to God...."
TitMainTitle: Demolition of Bethel AME Church, Wylie Avenue and Elm Street, Lower Hill District
